intro: Hanguana malayana subsp. anthelminthica, commonly known as the Malayan hanguana, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments, often growing in shaded, moist undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered plant.
